original: Erici, Eric Gunnar, överste, Borås, f. 16/6/82 i Rinna, östergötl. 1., av kyrkoh. Anton Erickson o. Erika Erickso-n. G. 10 m. Anna Östberg, Barn: Jan f. 11, kontr :ing. v. Bofors A-B, Lena 12, g. m. kapt. Claes Lundgren, 1. 15, Miari-Ann 15, g. m. kapt, Gunnar Almqvist, Lv., Per-Olov 17^ sjökapt., löjtn. i mar. res., anist. v. S. A. S. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 00. Und:-löjtn. v. Fortif. 03, löjtn. 07, v. Livreg. gren. 11, kapten 17, major i armén 28, v. Älvsb. reg. 30, överste 37. Lär. v. KS 16-23. Led. av stadsfullm. i Örebro 27-30, gille-smäst. i Östg. gille i Borås 33-45, pres. i Borås Ro.tarykl. 43, styr :kd. i See Fabr. A-B i Sandviken fr. 44. SF :.s platschef i Borås sed. 36. Skr.: Takt. ex. (25). RSO, Land-■stSM, Örebro dfbSM, Älvsb. IfbGM, FS ftjK.
translated: Erici, Eric Gunnar, Colonel, Borås, b. June 16th, 1882 in Rinna, Östergötland, son of Reverend Anton Erickson and Erika Erickson. Married for 10 years to Anna Östberg with the following children: Jan, born in 1911 and serving as a contract engineer at Bofors A-B, Lena, born in 1912 and married to Captain Claes Lundgren, 1st Infantry Regiment, Maria-Ann, born in 1915 and married to Captain Gunnar Almqvist, Air Force, and Per-Olov, born in 1917 and serving as a naval captain and reserve lieutenant in the Swedish Navy, as well as being an assistant at S.A.S. Erici passed his studentexamen in Norrköping in 1900. He became a Second Lieutenant of Fortification in 1903, Lieutenant in 1907, and served in the Life Regiment Grenadiers until 1911. He then was promoted to Captain in 1917, Major in 1928 while in the Army, and then became a Colonel in 1937 while serving in the Älvsborg Regiment. He was also a teacher at Karlberg War College from 1916 to 1923. Erici was a member of the city council in Örebro from 1927 to 1930, a guild master of the Östgöta Guild in Borås from 1933 to 1945, president of the Borås Rotary Club in 1943, and was on the board of See Fabr. A-B in Sandviken from 1944. He served as the local manager of SF (Swedish Railways) in Borås from 1936. Erici wrote Takt. ex. (25) and has been awarded the Order of Vasa (RSO), the Grand Silver Medal of the Order of the Sword (LandstMM), the Örebro Provincial Federation's Gold Medal (Örebro dfbSM), the I. Class of the Elfsborgs Province Federation Medal (Älvsb. IfbGM), and the Swedish Red Cross Merit Badge (FS ftjK).

structured.description: Eric Gunnar Erici was a Colonel from Borås, born on June 16th, 1882 in Rinna, Östergötland. He was the son of Reverend Anton Erickson and Erika Erickson. Eric was married to Anna Östberg for 10 years and had four children: Jan, Lena, Maria-Ann, and Per-Olov. He had a studentexamen from Norrköping in 1900 and served in the military, becoming a Colonel in 1937 while serving in the Älvsborg Regiment. He was also a teacher at Karlberg War College and served on various boards and organizations throughout his life. Erici wrote Takt. ex. (25) and has been awarded the Order of Vasa (RSO), the Grand Silver Medal of the Order of the Sword (LandstMM), the Örebro Provincial Federation's Gold Medal (Örebro dfbSM), the I. Class of the Elfsborgs Province Federation Medal (Älvsb. IfbGM), and the Swedish Red Cross Merit Badge (FS ftjK).
